intro: Dampiera dentata, commonly known as the coastal daisy or narrow-leaved daisy, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its small, showy white or pale blue flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy or gravelly soils. It has linear, toothed leaves and is often found in dune environments. Dampiera dentata is known for its resilience to salt spray and wind, making it a hardy species in harsh coastal conditions.
